Package tbirchi

Class CFTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • tbirchi.CFTree
  • public class CFTree
extends java.lang.Object
    The class implements an object that present the incremental cluster feature tree.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description

      The constructor creates a new incremental cluster feature tree with the corresponding parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CFTree

        public CFTree​(int maxNodeEntries,
              int maxNumberOfNodes,
              double lambda,
              double distanceThreshold,
              int checkStep,
              int maxBins,
              int sizeOfBin,
              double delta,
              int largeWindowSize,
              double largeWindowProbability,
              int smallWindowSize,
              double smallWindowProbability,
              double clusterSizeThreshold,
              double intraClusterThreshold,
              int distanceFunction,
              java.lang.String name)
        The constructor creates a new incremental cluster feature tree with the corresponding parameters.
        Parameters:
        maxNodeEntries - int value that presents the maximum number of incremental cluster features that incremental cluster feature node can store.
        maxNumberOfNodes - int value that present the maximum number of incremental cluster feature nodes that incremental cluster feature tree can store.
        lambda - double value that presents the fading factor for forgetting old data.
        distanceThreshold - double value that presents the initial incremental cluster feature radius threshold.
        checkStep - int value that presents the number of iterations before we check for anomaly.
        maxBins - int value that presents the maximum number of bins the exponential histogram can have.
        sizeOfBin - int value that presents the maximum number of values inside a single bin.
        delta - double value that presents the maximum delta (confidence) value for the ADWIN windows.
        largeWindowSize - int value that presents the size of the long-term window of short-term models.
        largeWindowProbability - double value that presents the maximum probability of a given detection mechanism triggering to still be considered useful.
        smallWindowSize - int value that presents the size of the short-term window of short-term models.
        smallWindowProbability - double value that presents the minimum probability of a given detection mechanism triggering to still be considered useful.
        clusterSizeThreshold - double value that presents the multiplication factor for the harmonic mean to determine normal clusters based on their size.
        intraClusterThreshold - double value that presents the multiplication factor for the standard deviation to determine distance threshold.
        distanceFunction - int value that presents the type of distance function to be used by the incremental cluster feature.
        name - String value that presents the name of the corresponding incremental cluster feature.

    • Method Detail

      • insertPoint

        public SplitChangeDifference insertPoint​(double[] point,
                                         java.time.LocalDateTime timestamp)
        The method insert a new data point to the incremental cluster feature tree.
        Parameters:
        point - double array that present the input data point.
        timestamp - LocalDateTime object that presents the timestamp of the data point.
        Returns:
        SplitChangeDifference object that presents whether certain incremental cluster feature should be split and the corresponding anomaly predictions from the current data point analysis.

      • getLeafList

        public CFNode getLeafList()
        The method returns the starting incremental cluster feature node of the leaf incremental cluster feature nodes list.
        Returns:
        CFNode object that presents the starting incremental cluster feature node of the leaf incremental cluster feature nodes list.

      • getIdCounter

        public java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong getIdCounter()
        The method returns the current value of the unique identifier counter object.
        Returns:
        AtomigLong object that presents the current value of the unique identifier counter object.

      • setIdCounter

        public void setIdCounter​(java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong idCounter)
        The method replaces the current unique identifier counter object with a new one from the input parameter.
        Parameters:
        idCounter - AtomicLong object that presents the unique identifier counter object.

      • print

        public void print​(java.lang.String filename)
        The method prints the current incremental cluster feature tree in a print friendly format.
        Parameters:
        filename - String object that present the name of the output file.
